Django -v: 3.0.6

items.title: Any way to add more attributes to <body> tag?
items.body:
It might be great if one could add custom attributes to `<body>`, maybe by overwriting some block.

The related line:
https://github.com/sehmaschine/django-grappelli/blob/74f227539bb9e8e473d18185db67cbb120f02ea3/grappelli/templates/admin/base.html#L68

Could we move `{% block bodyclass %}` to the end of this line?
```html
<body class="{% if is_popup %}grp-popup {% endif %}{% if LANGUAGE_BIDI %}rtl {% endif %}{% block bodyclass %}{% endblock %}">
```
So that a user could "shamelessly" inject attributes like:
```python
{% block bodyclass %}" data-custom-attribute="foobar{% endblock %}
```
Or could we introduce a new block?   <--- This might be better, but harder to get approved?

Thanks.

items.title: Remove jQuery
items.body:
With jQuery being deprecated, and new security vulnerabilities not patched it is important to migrate to a maintained library/framework.

https://blog.jqueryui.com/2017/12/the-future-of-jquery-ui-and-jquery-mobile/

Which framework/project could Grappelli migrate to that provides more features and better support?
Are there plans to start a feature branch for this?

Thanks

items.title: sortable_field breaks when placed in a field tuple with another number field
items.body:
Hey,
there's an issue with evaluating a sortable_field.
Assume a class Step that has 2 fields: evaluation_order and display_order. We want the Step inlines in the admin to use the evaluation_order as a controling field for the sorting. All works well until you put another field representing a number into a same field tuple of the admin together with evaluation_order. Manually changing display_order now moves the inline around like if you changed evaluation_order. This happens no matter what type the other field is if there's a numeric representation. Tried with PositiveSmallInteger, Integer, Float, even ForeignKey.

```
class Step(HasOwnerModel, TaggableModel):
    name = model.CharField(max_length=127)
    evaluation_order = models.PositiveSmallIntegerField(null=True)
    display_order = models.PositiveSmallIntegerField(null=True)

    class Meta:
        ordering = ('evaluation_order',)

class StepInlineAdmin(admin.StackedInline):
    model = Step

    #  fields = (('evaluation_order', 'name'), 'display_order')   # this definition works
    fields = (('evaluation_order', 'name',  'display_order'),)   # this definition causes issues
    sortable_field_name = "evaluation_order"
```

items.title: "Recent Actions" "My Actions" being not translated
items.body:
Hi,
this has been happened in the past (see #753), but now in Django 2.2 it is spelled again:
_Recent actions_ and _My actions_ (Mark that _actions_ is now lower case!)
And so it gets not translated because in Grappelli it reads _Actions_ (Upper case first letter).
Affected files:
```
grappelli/templates/admin/index.html
grappelli/dashboard/modules.py
grappelli/dashboard/dashboards.py
```
Additionally, it should also be changed in the documentation.

Or should that be changed in Django?

items.title: Rearrange inlines
items.body:
**I am not able to rearrange my inlines in the admin interface.**
I read the [documentation](https://django-grappelli.readthedocs.io/en/latest/customization.html#rearrange-inlines) and this open [issue](https://github.com/sehmaschine/django-grappelli/issues/355).

As far as I understand is the key to have a `placeholder` class and 

>  a 2nd class which matches the class of the inline-group (which depends on your fieldsets). If you have an inline images the class would probably be images-group.

So give my inline model:
```
class MyInlineModel(admin.TabularInline):
    model = MyModel
    extra = 1
```
I'd expect the 2nd classes name to be `MyInlineModel-group`. Although I am unsure what 
> which depends on your fieldsets

from above exactly means 😄 .

This is my adapted code:
```
("Some Fieldset", {
    "classes": ("grp-collapse grp-open",),
    "fields": ("whatever",)
}),
("Rearranged Inline", {"classes": ("placeholder MyInlineModel-group",), "fields" : ()}),
("Another Fieldset", {
    "classes": ("grp-collapse grp-open",),
    "fields": ("whatever",)
}),

inlines = [MyInlineModel]
```
But I still have my inline at the end. I am afraid I might miss something obvious here 😄 .

items.title: Testing problems with patch 450ae71b9155b4a1d4ce68231cdc42cef922f975
items.body:
This is a fix for #903 and #897.

While testing this here and at the head of master branch, I observe odd behavior. 

My model has 9 filters, some are for fields in related dbs.  Lets say Filter1 (F1) and Filter2 F2) are fields on the db.  And Filter3 (F3) is a field on a related db.

If I set any ONE of F1, F2, or F3 it works as expected.

After setting F1 to a value, such as:
**http://127.0.0.1:8000/admin/repair/job/?F1__exact=20**

If I _change_ F1 to another value, such as "45", after pressing APPLY I get:
**http://127.0.0.1:8000/admin/repair/job/?F1__exact=20&F1__exact=45**
This appears to be displaying the correct query set. But I'm sure having the query string in the URL twice will cause problems at some point.

Some combinations of the filters, if set at the same time are ignored.  Trying to change one or more values after getting a compound filter to "stick" are still ignored.

I did a local checkout of the exact commit for your fix.  And I use Debug Toolbar to verify all files are loading from the GIT folder.  And, since I'm testing with the debug server all static files and templates are loaded from their source folders - collect static is not needed (actually has no effect I think).

What should I test or poke at next?

items.title: Small typo in comment in dashboard.utils
items.body: Should be believe rather than beleive.

items.title: admin filter issue
items.body:
I tried the latest code with Django 2.2
I had a problem with admin filters with an apply button.
If there is a filter on a custom defined class for a non model field, e.g.

    class DID_LERG_State(admin.SimpleListFilter):
    ...
    list_filter = (DID_LERG_State,)

then admin filters using this class do not work correctly.
I think part of the problem is in **grappelli.js** with this line:

    var filterQueryParams = values && values.filter(el => el.includes(fieldName + '__'));

The model fields have a fieldName with a suffix of "__exact", but custom defined search filters like the one above do not.  This causes an empty filterQueryParams, and the filter is not applied.

In addition in the template file: **templatetags/grp_tags.py**
The line:

    'field_name': spec.field.name,

fails because there is no "field" defined in custom defined filter classes like the one above.

items.title: Improvement Request:  setup the grappelli_docs so that including them does not require changing the library code.
items.body:
right now, to include the grappelli docs, I need to un-comment the docs lines in the grappelli/urls.py file.  this is pretty easy, but if/when I update grappelli, it's likely to be overwritten.

What feels like a better approach woudl be to have a second file, like docs_urls.py with the docs urls defined.  then the instructions would say somethign like, if you want to include the documentation, add another line to your urls file, like:

urlpatterns = [
    path('grappelli/', include('grappelli.urls')), # grappelli URLS
    path('grappelli/grp_doc/', include('grappelli.docs_urls')), # grappelli URLS
    path('admin/', admin.site.urls),
    ...
]

(here is what I did)
[docs_urls.txt](https://github.com/sehmaschine/django-grappelli/files/3513322/docs_urls.txt)


(without knowing enough about the overall grappelli design

items.title: InlineTabular requires a custom model with "sortable_field = 'id'" even if I dont want sortable rows.
items.body:
IF I use an admin.TabularInline normally from django, I get the following error:
"Key 'position' not found in 'RelationshipForm'. Choices are: DELETE, id, person."
I dont need the sortability, so I did not setup the "position" field. 

The workaround for this seemed to be to setup "sortable_field = 'id'" in the model.  Is there a better approach to this that I missed in the docs?  perhaps what is needed is something like:

set the default for "sortable_field" to None, then if "sortable_field is None, if the "position" field is not present, disable sortability.  (you would also probably need a specific "disable_sorting" flag as well for the  case where someone has a "position" field, but is not using it for sorting (like "position" being used for a person's title or something).

items.title: Field Widths for read only fields in inlinetabular too small
items.body:
When I create an InlineTabular model, and add some fields that are marked as read-only.  the css currently drives those to what looks like g-d-1.  This seems to be due to the grp-tools-container being set to "width:100%"  I changed the css file to set it to 50% and it seems to work fine.

I don't, however, know if that change will cause other problems, so I hesitate to say that's the "fix". 

At least to me, the preferred behavior would be for read-only fields to look the same as normal ones just without editing.

items.title: related field proxy models
Choices do not update on apply with Filters as drop-down, manually applied feature.
items.body:
I am using the new feature for "atomic" change list filters in 2.13.1 as documented [here](https://django-grappelli.readthedocs.io/en/2.13.1/customization.html#filters-as-drop-down-manually-applied).

Which was from #897 

I have 5 fields for filters. Starting from default, where no filters are set, a user can set two or more filters, press **APPLY** and it works as expected.

However, if the user then changes their choices and presses **APPLY**, _ONE_ of the changes will be lost - it will use the _previous_ value.

For example, when the user first opens the filter, the first two fields are set as:
 - Status: All
 - Customer: All

The user changes them to:
 - Status: Ordered
 - Customer: ACME

After pressing **APPLY** the properly filtered results are displayed.

Now the user changes to:
 - Status: Paid
 - Customer: TAI

After pressing **APPLY**, the results are _incorrect_, the filters are set to:
 - Status: Ordered
 - Customer: TAI

The _STATUS_ choice has stuck/reverted to the previously selected value.  Freaky.

My software versions:
```

items.title: Related widgets don't show add-another icon
items.body:
The latest Grappelli no longer shows the add-another plus icon when there is more than one field on the related fields inline. 

The grp-related-widget-tools is using "display-inline" which doesn't seem to allow the relative positioning of the elements to expand. What we are stuck with is the add-another tool is wrapped below and hidden. Changing "display-inline" to "flex" solves the issue.

items.title: Stylesheet overrides django_select2 widgets
Use .get_username in object_history template
items.body:
Hello

It's a really small detail very easy to work around, but if you use a custom user model without a username field nor a get_full_name method (because it's defined on child classes), nothing is displayed in the user column of object histories.

https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/2.1/ref/contrib/auth/#django.contrib.auth.models.User.get_username
As per the docs, you should use the `.get_username` method that rely on the `USERNAME_FIELD` attributes.

To work around, define a username property on the custom user model or override the template.

Thanks for your work

items.title: Autocomplete Lookups does not work with multi-table inheritance
items.body:
We use  django 2.1.3 and django-grappelli 2.12.1 on python 3.7

------

We have an exception on `json/encoder.py`

``` 
TypeError: Object of type User is not JSON serializable
```

coming from the line : https://github.com/sehmaschine/django-grappelli/blob/f5153436ea822c5ef920f27c59083b69881b7084/grappelli/views/related.py#L47

our code is equivalent to this:

```python

class User(models.Model):
    pass

class Foo(User):
    name = models.CharField("name", max_length=200)

    @staticmethod
    def autocomplete_search_fields():
        return ("name__icontains",)

class Bar(models.Model):
    foo = models.ForeignKey(Foo, on_delete=models.SET_NULL)

class BarAdmin(admin.ModelAdmin):
    fields = ("foo", )
    raw_id_fields = ('foo',)

    autocomplete_lookup_fields = {
        'fk': ['foo'],
    }
```


------

After some search, we have isolated that error come from multi-table inheritance.

On the ajax call, that generate the error, JS send the get parameter `to_field=user_ptr` which is the name of the FK created by django to manage the multi-table inheritance. Please note it is the name of the FK field, not the id (which is `user_ptr_id`). So when Bar elements are retrieve, the data value extracted is then the parent User instance (and not their ID which is the primary key of the table). And then the json encoder can not dump it.

On the grappelli js code, this file is extracted from the raw_id_fields generated by django : https://github.com/sehmaschine/django-grappelli/blob/f5153436ea822c5ef920f27c59083b69881b7084/grappelli/static/grappelli/js/grappelli.js#L176 and it seems that for multi-table inheritance, it is the FK field that is provided, not the corresponding id.

-----

I have not a lot of idea how to fix this easily but if I can help...

items.title: Passwords are displaying in clear text
items.body: ## Issue Grappelli displays passwords in clear text ## Steps to Reproduce - Create a custom user model that inherits from contrib auth's AbstractUser - Set the user model in settings. - Register the user model in admin.py - Create a user - Set up grappelli per the docs. - In the admin, navigate to the edit model page for the user you created. - Observe the password is visible in clear text ## Expected Results I expect to never see a password in clear text within the admin interface.

items.body:
Stumbled upon this one today:
In TabularInline section, clicking on **Add another ...** link does nothing if my project language settings is not `en-en`:

```python

# `Add another ...` link does nothing

```

It seems weird but I can reproduce this all the time. I'm a bit clueless as to why this is happening (and new to *grappelli*).
Any pointer to where I should have a look?

items.title: Autocomplete broken after update
items.body:
Hi,

after upgrading Django and Grappelli to the latest version, I noticed that autocomplete no longer works. The culprit seems to be the line

```python
def ajax_response(data):
    return HttpResponse(json.dumps(data, cls=DjangoJSONEncoder), content_type='application/javascript')
```
in ``related.py``, which throws the following exception even for very simple models:
```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/Users/wjakob/Dropbox/projects/rgl-eb/lib/python3.7/site-packages/django/core/handlers/exception.py", line 34, in inner
    response = get_response(request)
  File "/Users/wjakob/Dropbox/projects/rgl-eb/lib/python3.7/site-packages/django/core/handlers/base.py", line 126, in _get_response
    response = self.process_exception_by_middleware(e, request)
  File "/Users/wjakob/Dropbox/projects/rgl-eb/lib/python3.7/site-packages/django/core/handlers/base.py", line 124, in _get_response
    response = wrapped_callback(request, *callback_args, **callback_kwargs)

  File "/Users/wjakob/Dropbox/projects/rgl-eb/lib/python3.7/site-packages/grappelli/views/related.py", 
line 256, in get
    return ajax_response(data)
  File "/Users/wjakob/Dropbox/projects/rgl-eb/lib/python3.7/site-packages/grappelli/views/related.py", line 47, in ajax_response

  File "/Users/wjakob/.anaconda/lib/python3.7/json/__init__.py", line 238, in dumps
    **kw).encode(obj)
  File "/Users/wjakob/.anaconda/lib/python3.7/json/encoder.py", line 199, in encode
    chunks = self.iterencode(o, _one_shot=True)
  File "/Users/wjakob/.anaconda/lib/python3.7/json/encoder.py", line 257, in iterencode
    return _iterencode(o, 0)
  File "/Users/wjakob/Dropbox/projects/rgl-eb/lib/python3.7/site-packages/django/core/serializers/json.py", line 104, in default

  File "/Users/wjakob/.anaconda/lib/python3.7/json/encoder.py", line 179, in default
    raise TypeError(f'Object of type {o.__class__.__name__} '
TypeError: Object of type Person is not JSON serializable
```

For reference, the definition of ``Person`` is:

```python
class Person(models.Model):
    first_name    = models.CharField('given name(s)', max_length=200)
    last_name     = models.CharField(max_length=200)
    webpage       = models.URLField('external web page', null=True, blank=True)
    github        = models.URLField('link to GitHub page', null=True, blank=True)
    email         = models.EmailField('email address', null=True, blank=True)
    app_label     = 'web'
    model_name    = 'person'

    def name(self):
        return self.first_name + ' ' + self.last_name

    def __str__(self):
        return self.name()

    @staticmethod
    def autocomplete_search_fields():
        return ("first_name__icontains", 'last_name__icontains',)

    class Meta:
        ordering = ['last_name', 'first_name']
```
I've tried stripping it down to just the name fields, and the exception still takes place (so I think it's a more fundamental issue).

items.title: Django 2.1 breaks ManyToManyField widget
items.body:
With Grappelli 2.11.1, multiple select widget is broken when running with Django 2.1, but fine in Django 2.0.8.  Multiple select widget can be find in `Home > Authentication and Authorization > Users` and look into Groups and User Permission.

In Django 2.0.8, the left-hand side box is a scrollable table.  In Django 2.1, the box becomes a single row with a drop-down arrow (but it won't expand).  It is scrollable in Safari but not in Chrome.

The issues affect Users admin to select groups and permissions, and any other admin page with ManyToManyField.

A deep comparison of Django 2.0.8 vs 2.1 reveals that the following line is changed and (may) cause the issue:

    2.0.8 /django/forms/widgets.py LINE 679:
            context['widget']['attrs']['multiple'] = 'multiple'

    2.1 /django/forms/widgets.py LINE 670:
            context['widget']['attrs']['multiple'] = True

A local test confirmed that, if revert the changes of above (True -> 'multiple'), the widget of `ManyToManyField` is back to normal.

A local test confirmed that, 2.1 without Grappelli does not suffer this problem (so I cannot file this as bug to djangoproject.com).  Django has changed the value of attrs from text to boolean.

items.title: Django 2.0 autocomplete compatibility
items.body:
Django Admin has autocomplete built in since 2.0. With all due respect to Grappelli, there are some advantages to it compared to Grappelli's. For me, the most important being that searched fields on related model are defined for the admin class, not the model. If there is a need for separate admin sites, this is a lifesaver.

The reason I am posting this and not the pull request is that I would propose to move towards Django Admin solution as being the default and keep the existing Grappelli approach as a fallback, as well as taking any advice before I dig in.

items.title: Related widget misses the edit and delete link
items.body:
Hi,

The edit and delete icons are missing from all related widgets so one can only add a new related object (or select an existing one) but not edit (or delete) it. I've looked into the issue and it seems that those parts of the widget HTML (`admin/widgets/related_widget_wrapper.html`) are commented out. The reason being probably that the JavaScript (`admin/js/admin/RelatedObjectLookups.js`) that should update the links is out of sync.

I managed to fix it locally, if you're open, I can attach a patch or make a pull request. (Couple of lines, really.)

VERSIONS: django-grappelli==2.11.1, Django==2.0.6
STATICFILES: OK
JAVASCRIPTS: OK
CUSTOMIZATIONS: None (except overriding the above mentioned two files to fix the issue)

items.title: Text in admin autocomplete fields not showing up.
items.body:
Hi,

I have a problem where the text generated by the autocomplete fk lookup is not being displayed in the form. This problem has appeared after upgrading to Django2.

I have searched the raw HTML of the page and the **text is there** -- it is simply not being rendered to the form.

This problem does not show up in my local dev environment (manage.py runserver) but shows up when running the site behind Nginx. I have verified:

1. XHR queries are being made and response is correct.
2. No missing JS.
3. No Missing CSS.
4. Text is actually present in the HTML, just not showing in the form.
5. Tested in 3 different browser.

Software versions:

Django==2.0.3
django-grappelli==2.11.1

Screenshot of the problem is attached; you can clearly see there are values (X) on the right of each row, but text is not being rendered.

Any idea?
![capturfiles-31-38-2018_12 38 55](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/159342/38158465-7dd97d4a-34e0-11e8-9567-8538b38f73c4.png)

items.title: Make it easier to override action select box
items.body:
We're using django-grappelli for Kiwi TCMS and one of our users reports an issue where they want us to remove the action select box and in this case replace it with a DELETE button on the top:
https://github.com/kiwitcms/Kiwi/issues/221

![screenshot](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/918446/36311597-148bc472-132c-11e8-9b33-5d6254d8cc24.png)

Looking at the templates it looks like:

1) Using `object-tools` block we can add more buttons at the top of the screen so easy to add a Delete button. Question is how does this button handle multiple selections ?

2) Not so easy to disable/remove the action select box.

Can you give some hints/comments on this ?

items.title: HTTP 414 for lengthy M2M autocomplete fields
items.body:
Any M2M field in the admin that is configured to be autocomplete-enabled will fail if there are too many relationships. This makes the admin unusable for such fields, even though the user can select and deselect items from an autocomplete field that appears blank. Environment: * Django version: 1.10.8 * django-grappelli version: 2.9.1 Steps to reproduce: 1. Make an M2M field, say a Group model with a M2M field to Users. 2. Specify in the `GroupAdmin` the following: ``` raw_id_fields = ['users'] autocomplete_lookup_fields = { 'm2m': ['users'] } ``` 3. Do appropriate setup in your `settings.py`: ``` GRAPPELLI_AUTOCOMPLETE_SEARCH_FIELDS = { 'user': { 'user': ('id', 'email', 'first_name', 'last_name') # whatever } } ``` 3. Associate many (say, 10k) Users with a particular Group. 4. Open the browser's network inspector and load this Group in the admin. Observe that the admin makes the following request and fails with HTTP 414. ``` http://localhost:8000/grappelli/lookup/m2m/?object_id=2%2C3%2C4%2C5%2C6%2C7%2C8%2C9%2C10%2C11%2C12... ``` The HTTP 414 response body is: ``` Error response

Error response

Error code 414.

Message: Request-URI Too Long.

Error code explanation: 414 = URI is too long.. ```

items.title: Under ChangeList you can not change the title
items.body:
Hello,

I'm overriding a change list class:
```
class BookChangeList(ChangeList):
    def __init__(self, request, model, list_display, list_display_links,
                 list_filter, date_hierarchy, search_fields, list_select_related,
                 list_per_page, list_max_show_all, list_editable, model_admin):
        super().__init__()

        self.title = 'Cool'

        # these need to be defined here, and not in BookAdmin
        self.list_display = ('name', 'categories')
        self.list_display_links = ['name']
        self.list_editable = ['categories'] 
```

Changing the title does not affect the view, see attached screenshot how it should look like:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33550454/35622670-577bf204-0691-11e8-8c48-5013af277bbd.png)

This is how it looks:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33550454/35622726-87545066-0691-11e8-91d3-7f152ad3729a.png)


VERSIONS: django-grappelli==2.10.1, Django==1.11.8
STATICFILES: OK
JAVASCRIPTS: OK
CUSTOMIZATIONS: Changing title

items.title: Conflict between style of tables
items.body:
As we don't have any specific table class for grappelli tables and we add styles to all tables, sometimes we face conflict between styles in third-party components that include tables. for example in CKEditor the gray borders are cause of grappelli and they don't exists in CKEditor:

![screenshot from 2017-12-26 23-24-08](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15300551/34363748-10790112-ea94-11e7-9b47-e5fec3e73319.png)

This mostly happens in RTL mode but it can happen anywhere and can break style of third-party components.
The solution is adding a specific class to all grappelli tables, for example `grp-table`.

@parsch Please change grp-edit-link to look like an edit link (I've been using the viewsite icon for now).

items.title: Pull down lists need whitespace between choices (or something)
items.body:
In a django 1.10.4 project with Grappelli 2.9.1 users are selecting wrong items in the tabular in-line pull-down choice lists.

They tend to get the item BELOW the one they want.  The choice names are similar so they frequently don't catch on.  Pandemonium ensues later.

Has anybody else seen this?

Hi
The RTL version of the grappelli is old and has many issues, can you please check it?

items.title: Support Django 2.0
items.body:
Slated to be released in December, adding support for Django 2.0 would be amazing. Last release RC1 happened 2 weeks ago, [here is the announcement][2].

First and foremost because of the [mobile-friendly `contrib.admin`][1]. I haven't had a chance to play around with it, but I bet they added responsive styles for inlines as well. This may be a lot of work, but I think the community would be happy to help out, I know I would myself!

Let's use this issue to discuss the roadmap (Target 3.X ?) and list the individual parts that need to be changed, to assist contributors with short concise PRs where possible.

[1]: https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/dev/releases/2.0/#mobile-friendly-contrib-admin
[2]: https://www.djangoproject.com/weblog/2017/nov/15/django-20-release-candidate-1-released/

items.title: Optimization of autocomplete_lookup_fields
Autocomplete lookup across apps not working
items.body:
VERSIONS: Grappelli 2.10.1, Django 1.11.3

Hi guys, I am trying to use autocomplete lookup of fields from another apps.

```
class MyModel(models.Model):
    sibling_fk = models.ForeignKey('SiblingModel')
    app_fk = models.ForeignKey('another_app.OtherModel')
```

```
class MyModelAdmin(admin.ModelAdmin):
    raw_id_fields = ('sibling_fk', 'app_fk')
    autocomplete_lookup_fields = {
        'fk': ['sibling_fk', 'app_fk'],
    }
```

Autocomplete for `sibling_fk` works fine, but  for `app_fk`, grappelli is not able to produce correct autocomplete url. What I am getting is url where app_label is false and model_name is false.
`/grappelli/lookup/autocomplete/?term=abc&app_label=false&model_name=false&query_string=false`


Also autocompletes between fields in other models in `another_app` works fine.

Thanks for your help.

items.title: Related Lookup problem
items.body:
I recently updated from django 1.5 to 1.11 and grappelli to 2.9.1 and I noticed that all my edit buttons (pencils) stopped working when there is an existing item.
Updating to grappelli  2.10.1 which supports django 1.11 the pencils completely dissapear

_models.py_
```
class Collection(models.Model):
    items = models.ManyToManyField(...)
```
_admin.py_
```
class CollectionAdmin(admin.ModelAdmin):
    model = Collection
    fieldsets = (
        (None, {'fields': (..., 'item',)}),
    )
```
This used to work with the older versions of django and grappelli.

I am not sure if this a bug or me not configuring things properly. I tried [this](https://django-grappelli.readthedocs.io/en/latest/customization.html#related-lookups) but it does not produce the outcome I expect (a dropdown with edit/create actions)
[This](https://github.com/sehmaschine/django-grappelli/blob/master/grappelli/static/admin/js/admin/RelatedObjectLookups.js#L185) is what I think creates the problem, but I guess if I put it back in I will have issues elsewhere?

Thank you

items.title: RelatedLookup missed "_to_field" handler
items.body:
it's really a problem that missing the handler in _get_data_  when the _get_filtered_queryset_ method have done:
```python
if k != "_to_field":
    ...
```
This leads to an unexpected _label_ replied to the requests for searching the _pk_ field without the real field it indicated in this area.

items.title: Template docs need help
items.body: I have no idea what do to with the information on in `docs/templates.rst`. The page `/grappelli/grp-doc/` on my site after following the quickstart 404's. There's a mention of something commented out by default... what is commented out, where?

items.title: The inline foreign key did not match the parent instance primary key
items.body:
When using a TabularInline with Grappelli, it looks like the management_form is not rendering properly (resulting in the error above).  I'm using Django 1.10.5 and Grappelli 2.9.1.  Thoughts on what might be causing this issue?

A sample of my admin classes for context : 

class BikeInline(admin.TabularInline):
    model = Bike
    fields = ('id', 'resident_name', 'phone', 'brand', 'color', 'serial', 'access',
              'status', 'registration_date', 'stolen_date')
    classes = ('grp-collapse grp-open',)
    extra = 0


class UnitBikeAdmin(admin.ModelAdmin):
    fields = ('id', 'address')
    list_display = ('id', 'address',)
    readonly_fields = ('id', 'address')
    search_fields = ('id', 'unit__address', 'bike__resident_name')
    search_fields = ('id', 'unit__address', )
    inlines = [BikeInline, ]

items.title: Autocomplete limits search results to ten.
items.body:
+ VERSIONS: 
  + Grappelli 2.9.1,
  + Django 1.11.1
+ STATICFILES: OK
+ JAVASCRIPTS: OK
+ CUSTOMIZATIONS: NONE.

I have set up one of  my model to use autocomplete, I get the correct widget and the search works fine. However, the search displays only the top ten search results and not the full results list. The [documentation](https://django-grappelli.readthedocs.io/en/latest/customization.html#autocomplete-lookups) makes no mention that the results are thus limited or how to change what the limit is.

items.title: Deprecated use of Context instance as template.render() parameter
items.body:
Seems like Django has deprecated using of Context instances in `template.render()`:
https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/1.11/releases/1.11/#django-template-render-prohibits-non-dict-context

But this is used in `admin_list_filter` templatetag.

items.title: Popup closing issue
items.body:
Recently I started facing the issue when popup freezes in the **Popup closing...** state. 

I investigated and found that when I click **Save** in the popup, it refreshes and I get this error in Google Chrome console:
```
Uncaught SyntaxError: Unexpected end of JSON input
    at JSON.parse (<anonymous>)
    at popup_response.js:4
    at popup_response.js:16
```

I debugged further and found that `document.getElementById('django-admin-popup-response-constants').dataset.popupResponse`, which we pass to the `JSON.parse(..)` is empty.

Then I checked view source of the page when it is in the **Popup closing...** state, and HTML looked like this:
```
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
  <head><title>Popup closing...</title></head>
  <body>
    <script type="text/javascript"
            id="django-admin-popup-response-constants"
            src="/static/admin/js/popup_response.js"
            data-popup-response="">
    </script>
  </body>
</html>
```

For some reason, `data-popup-response` is always empty.

Does anyone have ideas on why it started happening and how to fix it?

items.title: autocomplete fails if model has parent ordering
items.body:
Try ordering in meta model by parent field:
```
class MyModel(models.Model):
    parent = models.ForeignKey(...)
    class Meta:
        ordering = ['parent__created_date']
```
Then autocomplete for MyModel fails with 500 error

items.title: Error during template rendering
Use get_change_message in object history template
items.body: Django 1.10 brought new method `LogEntry.get_change_message()`, which nicely formats change messages (which become JSON in 1.10). So, Grappelli can use it, instead of just dumping JSON string in history table.

items.title: Having formatting or layout problem with import-export and Reversion
items.body:
I tried to add ExportMixin to my system.  Because I'm using 

https://github.com/etianen/django-reversion

Which uses its own custom admin, I had to use your ExportMixin.  When put second in the class list it did not seem to work.  So I put it first, as in:

`@admin.register(Parts)`
`class PartsAdmin(ExportMixin, VersionAdmin):`

Which works, but the change list view is not as shown in the sample photos. 

The "Add Parts" button used to be a large oval above the "Filter" tab. Both it and the "Export" button are simple text hyperlinks against the left hand margin.

Also, django-reversion had a "Recover Deleted" button beside the "add Parts" button, it seems to have vanished.

I'm going to start trying to untangle the various CSS logic in play here, but wanted to post first in case this is a know issue with a quick and easy fix.

Thanks in advance!

My setup:
 - Hosted on Python Anywhere
 - Django 1.10
 - Python 2.7

Cross-Posting this to all 3 libraries in use:
 
https://github.com/django-import-export/django-import-export/issues/561

https://github.com/etianen/django-reversion/issues/615

items.title: unable to change integer field widget from type "text" to "number"
items.body:
Is there something in Grappelli that would override all my attempts to get form widgets for integer fields back to type "number"?

I first tried turning OFF **USE_I18N** and **USE_L10N**.  Then I tried adding jquery to the admin media:


`    django.jQuery(document).ready(function($){`
`      $("[id$=-count]").css("text-align", "center");`
`      $("[id$=-count]").css("width", "4em");`
`      $("[id$=-count]").prop("type", "number");`
`      $("#id_form-0-count").attr("value", "666");`
`    });`


The selector works, I can see the CENTER and width adjustments working.  But not the TYPE change.  I even tried changing the value of one field just to convince myself the **prop** and **attr** functions work.

I'm starting to get annoyed with this and am posting here just in case this is a know and expected thing.

Thanks in advance!

items.title: Overwriting css classes
FilteredSelectMultiple widget is not used for m2m fields.
items.body:
VERSIONS: Grappelli 2.9.1, Django 1.10.2
STATICFILES: OK
JAVASCRIPTS: ERROR, addevent.js seems to be missing.
CUSTOMIZATIONS: NONE

Hi,

I am using django-grappelli 2.9.1 with Django 1.10.2 for the admin page.
In the earlier versions for django-grappelli and Django, if a m2m field is included in the 'filter_horizontal'
the FilteredSelectMultiple widget was used for m2m fields.

But in the latest version this seems to be missing and the reason is that one of the dependencies for SelectFilter2.js, 
the addevent.js has been removed.

I made a workaround to make this work.  I added the below lines in 'grappelli/templates/admin/base.html' after the
specification of jquery.js files.

```
   <script type="text/javascript">
       addEvent(window, "load", function(e) {
           SelectFilter.init("", "", 0, "/static/admin/"); 
       });
   </script>
```

Could this be included in the django-grappelli package so that I don't have to maintain the patched version.

Thanks and regards,
Vijay.

items.title: Actions Box - stop auto submit on selection
items.body:
**VERSIONS: Grappelli 2.7.1, Django 1.8.3
STATICFILES: OK
JAVASCRIPTS: OK
CUSTOMIZATIONS: NONE**

I am trying to use Django Import Export (https://github.com/django-import-export/django-import-export) with Grapelli. It changes the admin interface to add an extra selection box next to actions. This lets you select from the actions, "Export selected" and then choose the format you want to export the data in. 

Because Grapelli auto submits on selection of an action this won't work as the format can never be chosen. Is it easily possible to change this behaviour in Grapelli?

Many thanks 

Ian

items.title: change_list_template set to reversion/change_list.html ignoring admin/<my_app>/change_list.html and admin/<my_app>/<my_model>/change_list.html
items.body:
Hi, 

I had a problem with templates while adding a button to change_list.html 

context:

> django-grappelli==2.7.3
> Django==1.8.16
> django-reversion==2.0.7

I have expected same mechanism for **change_list** as **change_form**.
default structure seems to be ignored for both admin/<my_app>/change_list.html  and admin/<my_app>/<my_model>/change_list.html 
what I found is that variables are set differently:

```
change_form_template = None
change_list_template = reversion/change_list.html
```

I've found 2 solutions: 
changing default to `change_list_template = None` on modelAdmin is enough to make template engine look into  `admin/<my_app>/<my_model>/change_list.html  ` while all extension files need to `{% extends "reversion/change_list.html" %}` instead of `{% extends "admin/change_list.html" %}`
second solution would be creating EXACT change_list file that does desired changes in `reversion/change_list.html`


Desired effect: 
Ability to extend Admin list view with admin/<my_app>/<my_model> OR docs entry that this is done differently. Bellow print screen with example buttons, 1 model specyfic, 1 global.
![zrzut ekranu z 2016-11-24 12-46-41](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/20792810/20598127/dc77e412-b247-11e6-9bb7-87e0b45c2a3b.png)
